title: How to Shorten a YouTube Video in PowerPoint: 4 Easy Ways

steps.title: Navigate to the desired YouTube video.
steps.content: Navigate to the desired YouTube video. While you can't trim an online video using PowerPoint, you can use YouTube's clip feature to trim and share a certain part of a video. [1] X Research source Keep in mind that clips are public.

steps.title: Click ••• .
steps.content: Click ••• . This is below the video. More options will expand.

steps.title: Click Clip.
steps.content: Click Clip . The clipping editor will open.

steps.title: Set your clip.
steps.content: Set your clip. Drag the blue rectangle to select the part of the video you want to save. Use the start and end points to shorten the video or make it longer.

steps.title: Enter a title and click Click Share clip.
steps.content: Enter a title and click Click Share clip . A title is required to post your clip. You will see the Share clip option at the bottom-right corner.

steps.title: Copy the link.
steps.content: Copy the link. Once the clip is created, you'll see a pop-up menu with your clip link. Click Copy or manually select the link and copy it .

steps.title: Open Microsoft PowerPoint and select Record.
steps.content: Open Microsoft PowerPoint and select Record . You can find this in the top toolbar. Make sure you're on the tab where you want the video. On some versions of PowerPoint, you may need to click the Insert tab instead.

steps.title: Click Video.
steps.content: Click Video . This is in the Auto-play Media section.

steps.title: Click Online Video.
steps.content: Click Online Video . This will open a new menu.

steps.title: Paste the HTML code into the field.
steps.content: Paste the HTML code into the field. You can press CTRL + V (Windows) or CMD + V (Mac) to paste. The video may take a few seconds to load.

steps.title: Click Insert.
steps.content: Click Insert . This will insert your YouTube clip.

steps.title: Find your desired video.
steps.content: Find your desired video. Make sure to determine your desired start and end point. You likely already have these timestamps in mind, but if not, use the YouTube video scrubber to determine where you would like to begin and end the video.

steps.title: Click Share.
steps.content: Click Share . The Shar e icon is indicated by an arrow, found underneath the YouTube video.

steps.title: Click Embed.
steps.content: Click Embed . It is the leftmost option, and is represented by a greater-than-sign and a less-than-sign pointing away from one another.

steps.title: Copy the entire string of HTML text.
steps.content: Copy the entire string of HTML text. Clicking "Embed" pulls up a large body of HTML. Copy the entire text to your device's clipboard. Be sure to copy the HTML. Do not copy the link to the YouTube video.

steps.title: Open Microsoft PowerPoint and select Record.
steps.content: Open Microsoft PowerPoint and select Record . You can find this in the top toolbar. Make sure you're on the tab where you want the video. On some versions of PowerPoint, you may need to click the Insert tab instead.

steps.title: Click Video.
steps.content: Click Video . This is in the Auto-play Media section.

steps.title: Click Online Video.
steps.content: Click Online Video . This will open a new menu.

steps.title: Paste the HTML code into the field.
steps.content: Paste the HTML code into the field. You can press CTRL + V (Windows) or CMD + V (Mac) to paste. The video may take a few seconds to load. Before you insert the video, you'll need to add the timestamp to the URL.

steps.title: Use the format ?start=[time]&end=[time].
steps.content: Use the format ?start=[time]&end=[time] . Place the text immediately after the URL, towards the beginning of your HTML code. Replace [time] with your desired values. The HTML code only interprets positive integers, and measures the video length in terms of seconds. For example, if you want your video to start at 0:20 and end at 6:00, enter ?end=20&start=360 to the end of the YouTube URL. This should be within the URL's quotation marks.

steps.title: Click Insert.
steps.content: Click Insert . This will insert the shortened YouTube video. If this doesn't work, it's likely that the YouTube video doesn't allow embedding. You can try shortening a downloaded video or using screen recording instead.

steps.title: Open Microsoft PowerPoint and select Record.
steps.content: Open Microsoft PowerPoint and select Record . You can find this in the top toolbar. Make sure you're on the tab where you want the video. On some versions of PowerPoint, you may need to click the Insert tab instead.

steps.title: Click Video.
steps.content: Click Video . This is in the Auto-play Media section.

steps.title: Click This Device.
steps.content: Click This Device . You can also select Stock Videos to select from Microsoft's library.

steps.title: Select and insert your video.
steps.content: Select and insert your video. Locate the video on your device or select one from Microsoft's library. Click Insert to add it to your PowerPoint presentation.

steps.title: Click Playback.
steps.content: Click Playback . This is in the top toolbar. If you don't see it, double-click your video.

steps.title: Click Trim Video.
steps.content: Click Trim Video . This is in the toolbar.

steps.title: Trim your video.
steps.content: Trim your video. Determine where you want the beginning and end of the video clip to be. Click and drag the markers as needed. Use the green marker to set the beginning of the clip and the red marker to set the end of the clip.

steps.title: Click OK.
steps.content: Click OK . The video will be trimmed.

steps.title: Open a slide in your PowerPoint presentation.
steps.content: Open a slide in your PowerPoint presentation. Make sure it is the slide in which you want to place your YouTube video. This feature is not available for Office online.

steps.title: Go to the Insert tab and click Screen Recording.
steps.content: Go to the Insert tab and click Screen Recording . It should be the furthest option to the right, represented by a small video camera and a box. Your computer will then display an overlay for screen recording. The order of the icons may differ across different iterations of Microsoft PowerPoint.

steps.title: Open your desired YouTube video and click "Select Area" on the overlay's control menu.
steps.content: Open your desired YouTube video and click "Select Area" on the overlay's control menu. Your computer will then display a small cross-haired cursor. Click on it and drag it to create a box around the video. PowerPoint will record whatever is inside the box, so be sure to fit it as tightly around your video as possible. PowerPoint will automatically record your screen's audio, as well as your cursor if it is within view. To change these settings, simply deselect them on the overlay's control panel.

steps.title: Determine your desired start point.
steps.content: Determine your desired start point. Prepare to play the video from wherever you would like it to begin. If you want to start the video from the beginning, simply allow it to play normally.

steps.title: Click Record.
steps.content: Click Record . When you have your desired start point ready, click "Record" and play the video. You may click "Pause" at any time to stop the recording temporarily. Remember to pause the YouTube video as well, or it will jump when you play your recording back.

steps.title: Click Stop when the video reaches your desired endpoint.
steps.content: Click Stop when the video reaches your desired endpoint. This will end your recording.

steps.title: Save your PowerPoint presentation.
steps.content: Save your PowerPoint presentation. Click File and then Save to save your PowerPoint. Your recording will now be embedded in your intended slide.
